alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Hancock; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 7:29PM EDT until July 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Hancock County in central Indiana... Northern Marion County in central Indiana... Southwestern Hamilton County in central Indiana... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 729 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Zionsville, or 9 miles north of Indianapolis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Carmel around 735 PM EDT. Broad Ripple and Indiana State Fairgrounds around 740 PM EDT. Castleton around 745 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Warren Park, Geist Reservoir, Indianapolis, Lawrence, Cumberland and McCordsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 202. Interstate 70 between mile markers 86 and 98. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
